intro: Vandellia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leafed vandellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
